org.jlokalize
Class Main

java.lang.Object
  org.jlokalize.Main

public class Main
extends java.lang.Object

This is the main entry point for the JLokalize application. We setup all necessary things and then createAndRun an editor frame. Upon shutdown we save the options.

Field Summary

          Path to the jar file.
static org.tools.i18n.PropertyWithStats options

Field Detail

options

public static final org.tools.i18n.PropertyWithStats options
A global options variable, accessible by everyone and set relatively early on.

jarPath

public static java.lang.String jarPath
Path to the jar file.

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main entry point for the application. We setup the logger, the options and languages, the look and feel, the spell checker and then the editor frame is started.

Parameters:
args - the command line arguments

setupLanguage

public static boolean setupLanguage(java.lang.String prefLanguage)
                             throws java.io.IOException
From all available languages (properties files in JLokalize.config/lang) either choose one via a selection dialog or take an options entry and load a PropertyWithStats object from it. English is set as master. The default locale of the gui is also updated. The dialog is displayed if the preferred language equals "none".

Parameters:
prefLanguage - An id code of the preferred language or "none".
Returns:
True if indeed a language was chosen.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If any IO operation fails.

Shutdown

public static void Shutdown()
This is called before exiting the application, when the editor frame is disposed. We save the options and the statistics of the used language object.
